intro: Senecio royleanus, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Senecio royleanus is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
